test_cases.Title: Verify Display of Probabili Formazioni for All Serie A Teams

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Fantacalcio section of the application.
Steps.Expected Result: Fantacalcio section loads successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'Probabili Formazioni' feature.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Probabili Formazioni' page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Check that all Serie A teams are listed with their probable lineups.
Steps.Expected Result: Each Serie A team is displayed with a corresponding probable lineup.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is authenticated and has access to the Fantacalcio section.
test_cases.Functionality: Display of probable lineups for Serie A teams
test_cases.Dataset: Serie A teams and their latest probable lineups
test_cases.Expected Result: All Serie A teams are listed with accurate probable lineups on the 'Probabili Formazioni' page.

test_cases.Title: Verify Update of 'Ultime dai campi' News Section

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Fantacalcio section of the application.
Steps.Expected Result: Fantacalcio section loads successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'Ultime dai campi' feature.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Ultime dai campi' news section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Check the timestamp or date of the latest news update.
Steps.Expected Result: The news section displays the most recent updates relevant to team formations and player status.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is authenticated and has access to the Fantacalcio section.
test_cases.Functionality: Display and update of latest news from the fields
test_cases.Dataset: Latest news updates for Serie A teams
test_cases.Expected Result: 'Ultime dai campi' section displays the most recent and relevant news updates.

test_cases.Title: Verify Error Handling When Probabili Formazioni Data is Unavailable

Steps.Step Description: Simulate a scenario where the backend service for 'Probabili Formazioni' is down or returns no data.
Steps.Expected Result: The application attempts to load the 'Probabili Formazioni' page.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the message or behavior displayed to the user.
Steps.Expected Result: A user-friendly error message is displayed indicating that the probable lineups are currently unavailable.

test_cases.Preconditions: Backend service for probable lineups is intentionally made unavailable.
test_cases.Functionality: Error handling for unavailable probable lineups data
test_cases.Dataset: No data returned from backend for probable lineups
test_cases.Expected Result: A clear error message is shown to the user when probable lineups data is unavailable.

test_cases.Title: Verify Responsiveness of Probabili Formazioni on Mobile Devices

Steps.Step Description: Open the Fantacalcio section on a mobile device.
Steps.Expected Result: Fantacalcio section loads successfully on the mobile device.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Probabili Formazioni' feature.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Probabili Formazioni' page is displayed and formatted for mobile view.

Steps.Step Description: Scroll through the list of teams and lineups.
Steps.Expected Result: All content is visible, readable, and properly formatted for mobile screens.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is authenticated and using a supported mobile device.
test_cases.Functionality: Mobile responsiveness of probable lineups feature
test_cases.Dataset: Serie A teams and probable lineups
test_cases.Expected Result: 'Probabili Formazioni' page is fully responsive and user-friendly on mobile devices.

test_cases.Title: Verify Content Accuracy of 'Ultime dai campi' News

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Ultime dai campi' section in Fantacalcio.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Ultime dai campi' news section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Review the news items for a specific team or match.

test_cases.Title: Verify System Behavior When Fantacalcio API is Unavailable or Returns Errors

Steps.Step Description: Access the prematch campetti view for a match that would normally display Fantacalcio data.
Steps.Expected Result: Prematch campetti view loads, but Fantacalcio data is not available.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the UI displays an appropriate error message or fallback content, and does not crash or display stale data.
Steps.Expected Result: User is informed of the data unavailability with a clear message; UI remains stable.

test_cases.Channel: Desktop, Mobile, App IOS, App Android, Terminale
test_cases.Preconditions: Fantacalcio API is intentionally made unavailable or configured to return errors.
test_cases.Functionality: Error handling for Fantacalcio API unavailability
test_cases.Dataset: Simulated API error or unavailability scenario.
test_cases.Expected Result: System handles Fantacalcio API errors gracefully, displaying appropriate messages and maintaining UI stability.

test_cases.Dataset: Simulated incomplete or malformed API data scenario.
test_cases.Expected Result: System handles incomplete or malformed Fantacalcio API data gracefully, displaying available information and appropriate warnings or placeholders.

test_cases.Title: Verify API Fantacalcio Usage Precondition - Valid API Key

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the system is configured with a valid API key for Fantacalcio.
Steps.Expected Result: The system recognizes the API key as valid.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the Fantacalcio API endpoint using the valid API key.

test_cases.Expected Result: Fantacalcio API is accessible and returns a valid response when preconditions (valid API key) are met.

test_cases.Title: Verify API Fantacalcio Usage Precondition - Missing API Key

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the system is not configured with any API key for Fantacalcio.
Steps.Expected Result: No API key is present in the system configuration.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the Fantacalcio API endpoint without providing an API key.
Steps.Expected Result: The API request is rejected with an authentication error (e.g., 401 Unauthorized).

test_cases.Preconditions: System must not have any API key for Fantacalcio configured.
test_cases.Functionality: API authentication and precondition validation
test_cases.Dataset: No API key, API endpoint URL
test_cases.Expected Result: Fantacalcio API access is denied and an appropriate error is returned when the precondition (API key) is missing.

test_cases.Title: Verify API Fantacalcio Usage Precondition - Invalid API Key

Steps.Step Description: Configure the system with an invalid or expired API key for Fantacalcio.
Steps.Expected Result: The system stores the invalid API key.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the Fantacalcio API endpoint using the invalid API key.
Steps.Expected Result: The API request is rejected with an authentication error (e.g., 401 Unauthorized or 403 Forbidden).

test_cases.Preconditions: System must have an invalid or expired API key for Fantacalcio configured.
test_cases.Functionality: API authentication and precondition validation
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid or expired API key, API endpoint URL
test_cases.Expected Result: Fantacalcio API access is denied and an appropriate error is returned when the precondition (valid API key) is not met.

test_cases.Title: Verify API Fantacalcio Usage Precondition - API Key with Insufficient Permissions

Steps.Step Description: Configure the system with an API key for Fantacalcio that has insufficient permissions (e.g., read-only when write access is required).
Steps.Expected Result: The system stores the restricted API key.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to perform an operation on the Fantacalcio API that requires higher permissions than those granted to the API key.
Steps.Expected Result: The API request is rejected with a permissions error (e.g., 403 Forbidden).

test_cases.Preconditions: System must have an API key with insufficient permissions configured.
test_cases.Functionality: API authentication and precondition validation
test_cases.Dataset: API key with limited permissions, API endpoint URL, operation requiring higher permissions
test_cases.Expected Result: Fantacalcio API access is denied for operations requiring permissions not granted to the API key, and an appropriate error is returned.

test_cases.Title: Verify API Fantacalcio Usage Precondition - API Key Expiry Handling

Steps.Step Description: Configure the system with an API key for Fantacalcio that is set to expire soon.
Steps.Expected Result: The system stores the soon-to-expire API key.

Steps.Step Description: Wait until the API key expires.
Steps.Expected Result: The API key is now expired.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the Fantacalcio API endpoint using the expired API key.
Steps.Expected Result: The API request is rejected with an authentication error (e.g., 401 Unauthorized or 403 Forbidden).

test_cases.Preconditions: System must have an API key for Fantacalcio that is about to expire.
test_cases.Functionality: API authentication and precondition validation
test_cases.Dataset: Soon-to-expire API key, API endpoint URL
test_cases.Expected Result: Fantacalcio API access is denied and an appropriate error is returned when the API key has expired.

test_cases.Title: Verify OPTA ID Format Consistency Across All Entities in API Responses

Steps.Step Description: Send requests to both 'ProbableLineUpFULL' and 'LastFromFields' APIs.
Steps.Expected Result: Both APIs return successful responses with entity data.

Steps.Step Description: Extract all OPTA IDs from the response for each entity type.
Steps.Expected Result: All OPTA IDs are available for inspection.

Steps.Step Description: Validate that each OPTA ID matches the expected format (e.g., numeric, alphanumeric, length constraints as per OPTA documentation).
Steps.Expected Result: All OPTA IDs conform to the required format and constraints.

test_cases.Preconditions: APIs are accessible and OPTA ID format specification is available.
test_cases.Functionality: OPTA ID Format Validation
test_cases.Dataset: Sample responses from both APIs; OPTA ID format specification.
test_cases.Expected Result: All OPTA IDs in API responses are consistent and adhere to the defined format.

test_cases.Title: Verify Backward Compatibility for Existing API Consumers After OPTA ID Integration

Steps.Step Description: Send a request to 'ProbableLineUpFULL' and 'LastFromFields' APIs using legacy request formats (without OPTA ID fields in the request).
Steps.Expected Result: APIs return successful responses as per previous behavior, with the addition of OPTA ID fields in the response.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all existing fields and data structures remain unchanged except for the addition of OPTA ID fields.
Steps.Expected Result: No breaking changes are observed for existing consumers; only OPTA ID fields are added.

test_cases.Preconditions: APIs are accessible and legacy request formats are known.
test_cases.Functionality: Backward Compatibility
test_cases.Dataset: Legacy request payloads for both APIs.
test_cases.Expected Result: Existing API consumers experience no breaking changes after OPTA ID integration.

test_cases.Title: Verify successful mapping of Opta XML IDs to SDAPI IDs via OPTA Mappings Feed

Steps.Step Description: Obtain a valid Opta ID in XML format from Fantacalcio's dataset.
Steps.Expected Result: A valid Opta XML ID is available for testing.

Steps.Step Description: Send a request to the OPTA Mappings Feed API with the Opta XML ID as input.
Steps.Expected Result: The API processes the request and returns a response.

Steps.Step Description: Parse the API response to extract the mapped SDAPI ID.
Steps.Expected Result: The response contains a valid SDAPI ID corresponding to the input Opta XML ID.

test_cases.Preconditions: OPTA Mappings Feed API is integrated and accessible. Fantacalcio Opta XML IDs are available.
test_cases.Functionality: ID Mapping Conversion
test_cases.Dataset: Sample Opta XML IDs from Fantacalcio and expected SDAPI IDs.
test_cases.Expected Result: The OPTA Mappings Feed API correctly maps the provided Opta XML ID to the corresponding SDAPI ID.

test_cases.Title: Verify error handling for invalid or unknown Opta XML IDs

Steps.Step Description: Obtain an invalid or non-existent Opta XML ID.
Steps.Expected Result: An invalid Opta XML ID is available for testing.

Steps.Step Description: Send a request to the OPTA Mappings Feed API with the invalid Opta XML ID as input.
Steps.Expected Result: The API processes the request and returns a response.

Steps.Step Description: Check the API response for error messages or codes indicating the ID was not found or is invalid.
Steps.Expected Result: The response contains a clear error message or code indicating the Opta XML ID is invalid or not mapped.

test_cases.Preconditions: OPTA Mappings Feed API is integrated and accessible.
test_cases.Functionality: ID Mapping Conversion
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid or non-existent Opta XML IDs.
test_cases.Expected Result: The API returns a clear error message or code when an invalid or unknown Opta XML ID is provided.

test_cases.Title: Verify mapping feed supports batch conversion of multiple Opta XML IDs

Steps.Step Description: Prepare a batch request containing multiple valid Opta XML IDs from Fantacalcio.
Steps.Expected Result: A batch of valid Opta XML IDs is ready for testing.

Steps.Step Description: Send the batch request to the OPTA Mappings Feed API.
Steps.Expected Result: The API processes the batch request and returns a response.

Steps.Step Description: Parse the API response to verify that each Opta XML ID is correctly mapped to its corresponding SDAPI ID.
Steps.Expected Result: Each Opta XML ID in the batch is mapped to the correct SDAPI ID in the response.

test_cases.Preconditions: OPTA Mappings Feed API supports batch requests. Multiple valid Opta XML IDs are available.
test_cases.Functionality: Batch ID Mapping Conversion
test_cases.Dataset: Batch of valid Opta XML IDs and their expected SDAPI mappings.
test_cases.Expected Result: The API correctly maps all Opta XML IDs in the batch to their respective SDAPI IDs.

test_cases.Title: Verify API response time for single and batch mapping requests

Steps.Step Description: Prepare a valid single Opta XML ID and a batch of multiple Opta XML IDs.
Steps.Expected Result: Test data for both single and batch requests is ready.

Steps.Step Description: Send a single mapping request to the OPTA Mappings Feed API and measure the response time.
Steps.Expected Result: The response time for the single request is recorded.

Steps.Step Description: Send a batch mapping request to the API and measure the response time.
Steps.Expected Result: The response time for the batch request is recorded.

Steps.Step Description: Compare the measured response times against the defined performance criteria (e.g., <2 seconds for single, <5 seconds for batch).
Steps.Expected Result: Both single and batch requests meet the performance criteria.

test_cases.Preconditions: OPTA Mappings Feed API is integrated and accessible. Performance criteria are defined.
test_cases.Functionality: Performance of ID Mapping Conversion
test_cases.Dataset: Single and batch Opta XML IDs for performance testing.
test_cases.Expected Result: The API responds within the defined time limits for both single and batch mapping requests.

test_cases.Title: Verify mapping feed handles duplicate Opta XML IDs in batch requests

Steps.Step Description: Prepare a batch request containing duplicate Opta XML IDs.
Steps.Expected Result: A batch request with duplicate IDs is ready for testing.

Steps.Step Description: Send the batch request to the OPTA Mappings Feed API.
Steps.Expected Result: The API processes the batch request and returns a response.

Steps.Step Description: Check the API response to ensure that duplicate IDs are handled appropriately (e.g., mapped once, error, or warning as per specification).
Steps.Expected Result: The response clearly indicates how duplicates are handled according to the API specification.

test_cases.Preconditions: OPTA Mappings Feed API supports batch requests. Specification for duplicate handling is available.
test_cases.Functionality: Batch ID Mapping Conversion
test_cases.Dataset: Batch of Opta XML IDs with intentional duplicates.
test_cases.Expected Result: The API handles duplicate Opta XML IDs in batch requests according to the specification (e.g., returns mapping once, error, or warning).

test_cases.Title: Verify mapping feed rejects requests with missing or malformed Opta XML IDs

Steps.Step Description: Prepare a request with missing or malformed Opta XML ID fields (e.g., empty string, invalid format).
Steps.Expected Result: A request with missing or malformed IDs is ready for testing.

Steps.Step Description: Send the malformed request to the OPTA Mappings Feed API.
Steps.Expected Result: The API processes the request and returns a response.

Steps.Step Description: Check the API response for appropriate error messages or codes indicating invalid input.
Steps.Expected Result: The response contains a clear error message or code indicating the input is missing or malformed.

test_cases.Preconditions: OPTA Mappings Feed API is integrated and accessible.
test_cases.Functionality: Input Validation
test_cases.Dataset: Requests with missing or malformed Opta XML IDs.
test_cases.Expected Result: The API returns a clear error message or code when the input Opta XML ID is missing or malformed.

test_cases.Title: Verify successful retrieval of Fantacalcio data for a specific event and brand via API

Steps.Expected Result: Authentication is successful and an access token is obtained.

Steps.Step Description: Send a GET request to the Fantacalcio API endpoint with the event ID and brand identifier as parameters.
Steps.Expected Result: API responds with HTTP 200 OK and returns the expected Fantacalcio data for the specified event and brand.

test_cases.Preconditions: API is accessible; valid credentials for the brand are available; the event exists in the system.
test_cases.Functionality: Fantacalcio data retrieval for specific event and brand
test_cases.Dataset: Valid API credentials, existing event ID, valid brand identifier
test_cases.Expected Result: Fantacalcio data for the specified event and brand is successfully retrieved via API.

test_cases.Title: Verify API returns error for invalid event ID when requesting Fantacalcio data

Steps.Step Description: Authenticate with the API using valid credentials for the specified brand.
Steps.Expected Result: Authentication is successful and an access token is obtained.

Steps.Step Description: Send a GET request to the Fantacalcio API endpoint with an invalid event ID and a valid brand identifier.
Steps.Expected Result: API responds with an appropriate error code (e.g., 404 Not Found or 400 Bad Request) and error message indicating the event does not exist.

test_cases.Preconditions: API is accessible; valid credentials for the brand are available; invalid event ID is known.
test_cases.Functionality: Fantacalcio data retrieval error handling
test_cases.Dataset: Valid API credentials, invalid event ID, valid brand identifier
test_cases.Expected Result: API returns an error indicating the event does not exist when an invalid event ID is provided.

test_cases.Title: Verify API returns error for unauthorized access when using invalid credentials

test_cases.Preconditions: API is accessible; invalid credentials are available.
test_cases.Functionality: Fantacalcio API authentication
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid API credentials, valid event ID, valid brand identifier
test_cases.Expected Result: API denies access and returns an authentication error when invalid credentials are used.

test_cases.Title: Verify Fantacalcio API response time for data retrieval is within acceptable limits

Steps.Step Description: Authenticate with the API using valid credentials for the specified brand.
Steps.Expected Result: Authentication is successful and an access token is obtained.

Steps.Step Description: Send a GET request to the Fantacalcio API endpoint with valid event ID and brand identifier, and measure the response time.
Steps.Expected Result: API responds within the defined SLA (e.g., less than 2 seconds) and returns the expected data.

test_cases.Expected Result: Fantacalcio API responds within the acceptable response time for data retrieval.

test_cases.Title: Verify Fantacalcio API returns error for unsupported brand identifier

Steps.Step Description: Send a GET request to the Fantacalcio API endpoint with a valid event ID and an unsupported brand identifier.

test_cases.Expected Result: API returns an error indicating the brand is not supported when an unsupported brand identifier is provided.

test_cases.Title: Fantacalcio API Exclusion for Postponed Events (Status 6)

Steps.Step Description: Identify a soccer event in the system with Status field set to '6' (postponed) via the event API.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access Fantacalcio API functionalities for the identified event from the Sisal platform (e.g., retrieve Fantacalcio data, submit Fantacalcio-related actions).
Steps.Expected Result: Fantacalcio API functionalities are not available for the event; access is blocked or returns an appropriate error message.

test_cases.Preconditions: At least one event exists in the system with Status field set to '6' (postponed). Sisal platform is connected to both Fantacalcio and Sportradar Soccer V4 APIs.
test_cases.Functionality: Fantacalcio API exclusion for postponed events
test_cases.Dataset: Event with Status '6' (postponed) in the event API.
test_cases.Expected Result: Fantacalcio API is not accessible for events with Status '6' (postponed) on the Sisal platform.

test_cases.Title: Fantacalcio API Exclusion Regression Test for Postponed Events

Steps.Step Description: Identify multiple soccer events in the system, some with Status '6' (postponed) and others with different statuses.

test_cases.Title: Fantacalcio API is used only for matches with the highest Match Day value in MatchCalendar

Steps.Step Description: Access the MatchCalendar API for a specific competition (e.g., Serie A).
Steps.Expected Result: The API returns a list of matches with their associated Match Day values.

Steps.Step Description: Identify all matches currently quoted in the system (palinsesto) for that competition.
Steps.Expected Result: A list of quoted matches is available, each with its Match Day value.

Steps.Step Description: Determine the highest Match Day value among the quoted matches.
Steps.Expected Result: The highest Match Day value is correctly identified.

Steps.Step Description: For each quoted match, check if its Match Day equals the highest Match Day value.
Steps.Expected Result: Matches are correctly classified as either current/imminent (highest Match Day) or recovery (lower Match Day).

Steps.Step Description: Verify that Fantacalcio API is used only for matches with the highest Match Day value.
Steps.Expected Result: Fantacalcio API is used exclusively for matches with the highest Match Day value.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that for matches with lower Match Day values (recoveries), Fantacalcio API is not used and Sportradar is used for official lineups only.
Steps.Expected Result: Fantacalcio API is not used for recovery matches; Sportradar is used for official lineups.

test_cases.Preconditions: MatchCalendar API is accessible; quoted matches for multiple Match Days are present in the system.
test_cases.Functionality: Match Day-based API selection for Fantacalcio
test_cases.Dataset: Sample MatchCalendar API response with matches from different Match Days (e.g., Match Day 7 and Match Day 20).
test_cases.Expected Result: Fantacalcio API is used only for matches with the highest Match Day value; recovery matches use Sportradar for official lineups only.

test_cases.Title: Fantacalcio API is excluded for recovery matches (lower Match Day) even if quoted

Steps.Step Description: Access the MatchCalendar API for a specific competition (e.g., Serie A).
Steps.Expected Result: The API returns a list of matches with their associated Match Day values.

Steps.Step Description: Identify a quoted match in the system with a lower Match Day value than the current highest (e.g., recovery match).
Steps.Expected Result: A quoted recovery match is identified (e.g., Bologna-Milan, Match Day 7, when Match Day 20 is the highest).

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to retrieve Fantacalcio data for the recovery match.
Steps.Expected Result: Fantacalcio API is not called or returns no data for the recovery match.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that Sportradar is used for official lineups for the recovery match.
Steps.Expected Result: Sportradar provides the official lineups for the recovery match.

test_cases.Preconditions: MatchCalendar API is accessible; at least one quoted recovery match and one quoted current match are present.
test_cases.Functionality: Exclusion of Fantacalcio API for recovery matches
test_cases.Dataset: Sample MatchCalendar API response with at least one recovery match (lower Match Day) and one current match (highest Match Day).
test_cases.Expected Result: Fantacalcio API is not used for recovery matches; Sportradar is used for official lineups.

test_cases.Title: Fantacalcio API is used for all matches when only one Match Day is quoted

Steps.Step Description: Access the MatchCalendar API for a specific competition (e.g., Serie A).
Steps.Expected Result: The API returns a list of matches with their associated Match Day values.

Steps.Step Description: Ensure that all quoted matches in the system belong to the same Match Day (e.g., only Match Day 20 is quoted).
Steps.Expected Result: All quoted matches have the same Match Day value.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that Fantacalcio API is used for all quoted matches.
Steps.Expected Result: Fantacalcio API is used for all matches since they all have the highest (and only) Match Day value.

test_cases.Preconditions: MatchCalendar API is accessible; all quoted matches are from the same Match Day.
test_cases.Functionality: Fantacalcio API usage when only one Match Day is present

test_cases.Title: System correctly updates Fantacalcio API usage when new Match Day is quoted

Steps.Step Description: Access the MatchCalendar API for a specific competition (e.g., Serie A).

Steps.Step Description: Verify that Fantacalcio API is now used only for matches from Match Day 20, and not for Match Day 19.

test_cases.Functionality: Dynamic update of Fantacalcio API usage based on quoted Match Days
test_cases.Dataset: Sample MatchCalendar API response with initial and updated quoted matches (Match Day 19, then Match Day 20).

test_cases.Title: Correct Rendering of Player Formation Based on 'Trend' and 'Starter' Fields (4-2-3-1 Example)

Steps.Step Description: Access the 'Campetto' view in the Sisal client for a match with available ProbableLineup Full API data.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the graphical field ('Campetto') and the placement of each player.
Steps.Expected Result: Players are positioned according to the 4-2-3-1 formation, following the order from the 'Starter' list: 1st is goalkeeper, 2nd is right back, 3rd is right center back, 4th is left center back, 5th is left back, 6th is right defensive midfielder, 7th is left defensive midfielder, 8th is right winger, 9th is attacking midfielder, 10th is left winger, 11th is striker.

test_cases.Dataset: API response with 'Trend':'4231' and ordered 'Starter' list of 11 players.
test_cases.Expected Result: Players are displayed in the correct positions on the field according to the 4-2-3-1 formation, strictly following the order from the 'Starter' list, ignoring the 'position' attribute.

test_cases.Title: Display of Unavailable Players with Reasons in Field View for Both Teams

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the application and access the 'Campo' (Field) view for a match with unavailable players for both teams.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Campo' view is displayed for the selected match.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the section dedicated to unavailable players for Team 1.
Steps.Expected Result: A list of unavailable players for Team 1 is displayed, each with a textual reason for unavailability.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the section dedicated to unavailable players for Team 2.
Steps.Expected Result: A list of unavailable players for Team 2 is displayed, each with a textual reason for unavailability.

test_cases.Preconditions: At least one match exists where both teams have unavailable players defined in the unavailablesPlayers field of the ProbableLineupFULL API.
test_cases.Functionality: Display unavailable players and reasons in Campo view for both teams.
test_cases.Dataset: Match with both teams having unavailable players (e.g., Team 1: Player A - Injury, Team 2: Player B - Suspension).
test_cases.Expected Result: For both teams, the Campo view displays the correct list of unavailable players with their respective textual reasons, as provided by the API.

test_cases.Title: Campo View Does Not Display Unavailable Players Outside Field View

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to a view other than 'Campo' (e.g., Statistics, Overview, or Lineup).
Steps.Expected Result: The selected view is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Check for the presence of the unavailable players list and reasons in this view.
Steps.Expected Result: No list of unavailable players or reasons is displayed outside the Campo view.

test_cases.Preconditions: The application is loaded with a match where unavailable players exist for at least one team.
test_cases.Functionality: Restrict unavailable players list to Campo view only.
test_cases.Dataset: Match with unavailable players for at least one team.
test_cases.Expected Result: Unavailable players and their reasons are only visible in the Campo view and not in any other view.

test_cases.Title: Campo View Handles Absence of Unavailable Players Gracefully

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Campo' (Field) view for a match where neither team has unavailable players in the API response.
Steps.Expected Result: The Campo view is displayed for the selected match.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the section where unavailable players would be listed for both teams.
Steps.Expected Result: No unavailable players are displayed; the section is either hidden or shows a message such as 'No unavailable players'.

test_cases.Preconditions: A match exists in the system where the unavailablesPlayers field is empty or not present for both teams in the API response.
test_cases.Functionality: Graceful handling of empty unavailable players list in Campo view.
test_cases.Dataset: Match with no unavailable players for either team.
test_cases.Expected Result: If there are no unavailable players, the Campo view does not display the unavailable players section or shows an appropriate message.

test_cases.Title: Campo View Correctly Displays Multiple Reasons for Unavailability

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Campo' (Field) view for a match where at least one player has multiple reasons for unavailability (e.g., injury and suspension) in the API response.
Steps.Expected Result: The Campo view is displayed for the selected match.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the unavailable players list for both teams.
Steps.Expected Result: Players with multiple reasons have all reasons displayed clearly and completely in the list.

test_cases.Preconditions: A match exists where at least one player in the unavailablesPlayers field has multiple reasons for unavailability.
test_cases.Functionality: Display of multiple reasons for player unavailability in Campo view.
test_cases.Dataset: Match with a player having multiple unavailability reasons (e.g., Player C: Injury, Suspension).
test_cases.Expected Result: All reasons for each unavailable player are displayed as provided by the API, without truncation or omission.

test_cases.Title: Campo View Correctly Updates When API Data Changes (Unavailable Players Added/Removed)

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Campo' (Field) view for a match with initial unavailable players data.
Steps.Expected Result: The Campo view displays the current unavailable players and their reasons as per the API.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate an update in the API where unavailable players are added or removed for either team.
Steps.Expected Result: The API now returns an updated list of unavailable players.

Steps.Step Description: Refresh or revisit the Campo view for the same match.
Steps.Expected Result: The Campo view reflects the updated unavailable players list and reasons as per the latest API response.

test_cases.Preconditions: Ability to update or simulate changes in the unavailablesPlayers field of the API for a given match.
test_cases.Functionality: Dynamic update of unavailable players list in Campo view based on API changes.
test_cases.Dataset: Match with initial unavailable players, then updated API data (e.g., Player D added or removed).
test_cases.Expected Result: The Campo view always displays the current unavailable players and reasons as per the latest API data.

test_cases.Title: Display of Ballottaggio Players and Titolarit Percentage in Campo View

Steps.Step Description: Access the application and navigate to the Campo view for a match with two teams.
Steps.Expected Result: Campo view is displayed with both teams' probable lineups.

Steps.Step Description: For each team, identify the positions where there are players in ballottaggio (as per ballotsPlayers field from ProbableLineupFULL API).
Steps.Expected Result: Positions with ballottaggio are visually indicated in the Campo view.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that for each ballottaggio position, both players are displayed as a pair within the same role.
Steps.Expected Result: Both players in ballottaggio are shown together for the same role.

Steps.Step Description: Check that the titolarit percentage is displayed next to each ballottaggio player.
Steps.Expected Result: Each ballottaggio player has their titolarit percentage clearly shown.

test_cases.Preconditions: A match with at least one ballottaggio position per team is available. User is authenticated and has access to the Campo view.
test_cases.Functionality: Display of ballottaggio players and titolarit percentage in Campo view
test_cases.Dataset: ProbableLineupFULL API returns ballotsPlayers data for both teams with titolarit percentages (e.g., Team A: Player X 60%, Player Y 40%).
test_cases.Expected Result: In the Campo view, for each team, all ballottaggio pairs are displayed for the same role, with each player's titolarit percentage shown as per the API data.

test_cases.Title: Campo View: Absence of Ballottaggio Players When Not Present in API

Steps.Step Description: Access the application and navigate to the Campo view for a match where the ballotsPlayers field is empty in the ProbableLineupFULL API response.
Steps.Expected Result: Campo view is displayed for both teams.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that no ballottaggio pairs or titolarit percentages are displayed for any role.
Steps.Expected Result: No ballottaggio players or titolarit percentages are shown in the Campo view.

test_cases.Preconditions: A match with no ballottaggio positions (ballotsPlayers field is empty). User is authenticated and has access to the Campo view.
test_cases.Functionality: Conditional display of ballottaggio players based on API data
test_cases.Dataset: ProbableLineupFULL API returns ballotsPlayers as an empty array for both teams.
test_cases.Expected Result: No ballottaggio players or titolarit percentages are displayed in the Campo view when ballotsPlayers is empty.

test_cases.Title: Campo View: Handling of Invalid or Missing Titolarit Percentage in API

Steps.Step Description: Access the application and navigate to the Campo view for a match where ballotsPlayers contains a player with a missing or invalid titolarit percentage (e.g., null or non-numeric value).
Steps.Expected Result: Campo view is displayed for both teams.

Steps.Step Description: Verify how the application displays the titolarit percentage for the affected player(s).
Steps.Expected Result: The application handles the missing/invalid titolarit gracefully (e.g., displays '-', 'N/A', or hides the percentage), without breaking the layout or causing errors.

test_cases.Preconditions: A match where ballotsPlayers contains at least one player with missing or invalid titolarit percentage. User is authenticated and has access to the Campo view.
test_cases.Functionality: Robustness of titolarit percentage display for ballottaggio players
test_cases.Dataset: ProbableLineupFULL API returns ballotsPlayers with one player having titolarit: null or 'abc'.
test_cases.Expected Result: Campo view displays a placeholder or omits the titolarit percentage for players with invalid/missing data, maintaining UI integrity.

test_cases.Title: Campo View: Ballottaggio Players Displayed Only in Campo View, Not in Other Views

Steps.Step Description: Access the application and navigate to the Campo view for a match with ballottaggio players.
Steps.Expected Result: Campo view displays ballottaggio pairs and titolarit percentages as per requirements.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to another view (e.g., List, Statistics, or any view other than Campo) for the same match.
Steps.Expected Result: No ballottaggio pairs or titolarit percentages are displayed in views other than Campo.

test_cases.Preconditions: A match with ballottaggio players available in the API. User is authenticated and can access multiple views.
test_cases.Functionality: Scope limitation of ballottaggio players display to Campo view
test_cases.Dataset: ProbableLineupFULL API returns ballotsPlayers for the match. Other views are accessible for the same match.
test_cases.Expected Result: Ballottaggio players and titolarit percentages are shown only in the Campo view and not in any other view.

test_cases.Title: Campo View: Ballottaggio Players Displayed for Both Teams

Steps.Step Description: Access the application and navigate to the Campo view for a match where both teams have ballottaggio players in at least one position each.
Steps.Expected Result: Campo view is displayed with both teams' probable lineups.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that ballottaggio pairs and titolarit percentages are displayed for both teams, not just one.
Steps.Expected Result: Ballottaggio pairs and titolarit percentages are shown for both teams in the Campo view.

test_cases.Preconditions: A match where ballotsPlayers is populated for both teams. User is authenticated and has access to the Campo view.
test_cases.Functionality: Display of ballottaggio players for both teams in Campo view
test_cases.Dataset: ProbableLineupFULL API returns ballotsPlayers for both teams (e.g., Team A: Player X/Y, Team B: Player Z/W).
test_cases.Expected Result: Ballottaggio pairs and titolarit percentages are displayed for both teams in the Campo view.

test_cases.Title: Display of Doubtful Players List in Field View for Both Teams

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the application and access the match details page.
Steps.Expected Result: Match details page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Switch to the 'Field View' (Vista Campo) for the selected match.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Field View' is displayed, showing both teams' lineups.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the section dedicated to 'Doubtful Players' for Team 1.
Steps.Expected Result: A list of doubtful players for Team 1 is displayed, each with a textual reason.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the section dedicated to 'Doubtful Players' for Team 2.
Steps.Expected Result: A list of doubtful players for Team 2 is displayed, each with a textual reason.

test_cases.Preconditions: At least one match is available with doubtful players data present in the 'doubtsPlayers' field of the ProbableLineupFULL API response.
test_cases.Functionality: Display of doubtful players in Field View
test_cases.Dataset: Match with at least one doubtful player per team (API response includes 'doubtsPlayers' for both teams).
test_cases.Expected Result: In Field View, both teams display a list of doubtful players with their respective textual reasons, as provided by the API.

test_cases.Title: Absence of Doubtful Players Section When No Data Present

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the application and access the match details page for a match with no doubtful players.
Steps.Expected Result: Match details page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Switch to the 'Field View' (Vista Campo) for the selected match.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Field View' is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the area where the 'Doubtful Players' section would appear for both teams.
Steps.Expected Result: No 'Doubtful Players' section or message is displayed for either team.

test_cases.Preconditions: A match is available where the 'doubtsPlayers' field in the API response is empty or not present for both teams.
test_cases.Functionality: Conditional display of doubtful players section
test_cases.Dataset: Match with no doubtful players (API response has empty or missing 'doubtsPlayers').
test_cases.Expected Result: If there are no doubtful players, the section is not displayed for either team in Field View.

test_cases.Title: Correct Mapping of Doubtful Players Data from API to UI

Steps.Step Description: Intercept or review the ProbableLineupFULL API response for a match in Field View.
Steps.Expected Result: API response is available and contains 'doubtsPlayers' data for both teams.

Steps.Step Description: Compare the list of doubtful players and their reasons from the API response with what is displayed in the UI for both teams.
Steps.Expected Result: Each doubtful player and their textual reason in the UI matches exactly with the API data.

test_cases.Preconditions: Ability to access or intercept the API response for a match with doubtful players.
test_cases.Functionality: Data integrity between API and UI for doubtful players
test_cases.Dataset: Match with known 'doubtsPlayers' data in API.
test_cases.Expected Result: All doubtful players and their reasons are displayed in the UI exactly as provided by the API for both teams.

test_cases.Title: Display of Doubtful Players with Special Characters in Reason Text

Steps.Step Description: Prepare or select a match where the 'doubtsPlayers' field contains reasons with special characters (e.g., accented letters, punctuation).
Steps.Expected Result: API response includes special characters in the 'reason' field for at least one doubtful player.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Field View for the selected match.
Steps.Expected Result: Field View is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the display of the doubtful player's reason containing special characters.
Steps.Expected Result: Special characters are rendered correctly and legibly in the UI.

test_cases.Preconditions: Match with at least one doubtful player whose reason contains special characters in the API response.
test_cases.Functionality: Correct rendering of special characters in doubtful player reasons
test_cases.Dataset: Match with 'doubtsPlayers' reason field containing special characters (e.g., 'infortunio allinguine').
test_cases.Expected Result: Special characters in the reason text are displayed correctly for all doubtful players.

test_cases.Title: Display of Doubtful Players List on Mobile Devices

Steps.Step Description: Open the application on a mobile device and access the match details page.
Steps.Expected Result: Match details page is displayed on the mobile device.

Steps.Step Description: Switch to the 'Field View' (Vista Campo) for the selected match.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Field View' is displayed, adapted for mobile layout.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the 'Doubtful Players' section for both teams.
Steps.Expected Result: Doubtful players and their reasons are displayed correctly and are readable on the mobile device.

test_cases.Preconditions: Mobile device with the application installed. Match with at least one doubtful player per team.
test_cases.Functionality: Mobile compatibility for doubtful players display
test_cases.Dataset: Match with at least one doubtful player per team, accessed via mobile app.
test_cases.Expected Result: Doubtful players and their reasons are displayed correctly and legibly in Field View on mobile devices.

test_cases.Title: Verify Stadium Name Displayed Only in Field View

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the match list and select a specific match.
Steps.Expected Result: The match details page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Switch to the 'Field View' (vista Campo) for the selected match.
Steps.Expected Result: The Field View is displayed for the selected match.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the information displayed in the Field View, focusing on the stadium name.
Steps.Expected Result: The stadium name is displayed in the Field View, matching the value from the 'Stadium' field in the ProbableLineupFULL API for the selected match.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is authenticated and has access to the match list. At least one match is available with stadium information in the API.
test_cases.Functionality: Display of stadium name in Field View
test_cases.Dataset: Match with known stadium name in ProbableLineupFULL API response.
test_cases.Expected Result: The stadium name is displayed only in the Field View and matches the API value.

test_cases.Title: Verify Stadium Name Not Displayed in Other Views

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the match list and select a specific match.
Steps.Expected Result: The match details page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Switch to a view other than 'Field View' (e.g., Statistics, Overview, Lineup).
Steps.Expected Result: The selected view is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Check if the stadium name is present anywhere in the current view.
Steps.Expected Result: The stadium name is NOT displayed in any view other than Field View.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is authenticated and has access to the match list. At least one match is available with stadium information in the API.
test_cases.Functionality: Restriction of stadium name display to Field View only
test_cases.Dataset: Match with known stadium name in ProbableLineupFULL API response.
test_cases.Expected Result: The stadium name is not displayed in any view except Field View.

test_cases.Title: Verify Stadium Name Matches API Value

Steps.Step Description: Obtain the stadium name for a specific match from the ProbableLineupFULL API response.
Steps.Expected Result: The stadium name is retrieved from the API.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the match details and open the Field View for the same match in the application.
Steps.Expected Result: The Field View is displayed for the selected match.

Steps.Step Description: Compare the stadium name displayed in the Field View with the value from the API.
Steps.Expected Result: The stadium name displayed in the Field View matches exactly the value from the API.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is authenticated. API endpoint ProbableLineupFULL is accessible and returns stadium information for the selected match.
test_cases.Functionality: Data consistency between API and UI
test_cases.Dataset: Match with known stadium name in ProbableLineupFULL API response.
test_cases.Expected Result: The stadium name in Field View matches the API value exactly.

test_cases.Title: Verify Behavior When Stadium Name is Missing in API

Steps.Step Description: Select a match for which the ProbableLineupFULL API does not provide a stadium name (Stadium field is missing or empty).
Steps.Expected Result: Match details are available for selection.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Field View for the selected match.
Steps.Expected Result: The Field View is displayed for the selected match.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the area where the stadium name would normally be displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: No stadium name is displayed, or a default placeholder (e.g., '-') is shown, as per UI specification.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is authenticated. API endpoint ProbableLineupFULL is accessible and returns no stadium information for the selected match.
test_cases.Functionality: Handling of missing stadium name in API
test_cases.Dataset: Match with missing or empty stadium name in ProbableLineupFULL API response.
test_cases.Expected Result: No stadium name is displayed or a default placeholder is shown when the API does not provide a stadium name.

test_cases.Title: Verify referee name is displayed only in Campo view for a match

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the application and select a match from the list.
Steps.Expected Result: The match details page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Switch to the 'Campo' view for the selected match.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Campo' view is displayed for the selected match.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the match details in the 'Campo' view.
Steps.Expected Result: The referee's name, as provided by the 'referee' field in the ProbableLineupFULL API, is displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions: A match is available with referee information present in the ProbableLineupFULL API response.
test_cases.Functionality: Display of referee name in Campo view
test_cases.Dataset: Match with known referee name in API response (e.g., 'referee': 'John Doe')
test_cases.Expected Result: The referee's name is displayed only in the Campo view for the selected match, matching the API data.

test_cases.Title: Verify referee name is not displayed in views other than Campo

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the application and select a match from the list.
Steps.Expected Result: The match details page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Switch to a view other than 'Campo' (e.g., Statistics, Lineup, Overview).
Steps.Expected Result: The selected non-Campo view is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the match details in the selected non-Campo view.
Steps.Expected Result: The referee's name is not displayed anywhere in the non-Campo view.

test_cases.Preconditions: A match is available with referee information present in the ProbableLineupFULL API response.
test_cases.Functionality: Restriction of referee name display to Campo view only
test_cases.Dataset: Match with known referee name in API response (e.g., 'referee': 'John Doe')
test_cases.Expected Result: The referee's name is not visible in any view except Campo.

test_cases.Title: Verify correct referee name is displayed as per API response

Steps.Step Description: Mock or intercept the ProbableLineupFULL API response for a match to set the 'referee' field to a specific value (e.g., 'Jane Smith').
Steps.Expected Result: The API returns the mocked referee name for the match.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the application and select the corresponding match.
Steps.Expected Result: The match details page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Switch to the 'Campo' view for the selected match.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Campo' view is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the referee name displayed in the 'Campo' view.
Steps.Expected Result: The displayed referee name matches the value set in the API response (e.g., 'Jane Smith').

test_cases.Preconditions: Ability to mock or intercept API responses. The application is connected to the test environment.
test_cases.Functionality: Data consistency between API and UI
test_cases.Dataset: Mocked API response with 'referee': 'Jane Smith'
test_cases.Expected Result: The referee name displayed in the Campo view matches exactly the value from the API response.

test_cases.Title: Verify behavior when referee field is missing in API response

Steps.Step Description: Mock or intercept the ProbableLineupFULL API response for a match to omit the 'referee' field.
Steps.Expected Result: The API returns a response without the 'referee' field for the match.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the application and select the corresponding match.
Steps.Expected Result: The match details page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Switch to the 'Campo' view for the selected match.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Campo' view is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the area where the referee name would normally be displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: No referee name is displayed, or a suitable placeholder (e.g., 'N/A' or blank) is shown, according to UI specifications.

test_cases.Preconditions: Ability to mock or intercept API responses. The application is connected to the test environment.
test_cases.Functionality: Handling of missing referee data
test_cases.Dataset: Mocked API response without 'referee' field
test_cases.Expected Result: If the referee field is missing, the Campo view does not display a referee name or shows a placeholder as per UI guidelines.

test_cases.Title: Verify UI alignment and formatting of referee name in Campo view

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the application and select a match with a referee name present in the API.
Steps.Expected Result: The match details page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Switch to the 'Campo' view for the selected match.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Campo' view is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the referee name's position, font, and alignment in the Campo view.
Steps.Expected Result: The referee name is displayed according to the UI design specifications (e.g., correct font, size, color, and alignment as per design mockup).

test_cases.Preconditions: A match is available with referee information present in the API. Access to UI design specifications/mockups.
test_cases.Functionality: UI/UX compliance for referee name display
test_cases.Dataset: Match with known referee name in API response
test_cases.Expected Result: The referee name is visually aligned and formatted as per the approved UI design in the Campo view.

Steps.Step Description: Check the match details for the presence of Broadcaster information (e.g., broadcaster name, logo, or channel).

test_cases.Title: Verify No Broadcaster Information is Displayed for Fantacalcio Matches with Missing or Null Broadcaster Data

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and navigated to the main dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'List' and 'Field' views of matches.
Steps.Expected Result: Both views display all available matches.

Steps.Step Description: Identify a Fantacalcio match where the broadcaster field is missing or null in the backend data.
Steps.Expected Result: A Fantacalcio match with missing/null broadcaster data is identified.

Steps.Step Description: Check the match details for the presence of Broadcaster information.
Steps.Expected Result: No Broadcaster information is displayed for the Fantacalcio match, regardless of the backend data state.

test_cases.Preconditions: At least one Fantacalcio match with missing or null broadcaster data is available in the system.
test_cases.Functionality: Display logic for missing/null broadcaster data
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials, at least one Fantacalcio match with missing/null broadcaster data.
test_cases.Expected Result: No Broadcaster information is displayed for Fantacalcio matches even if broadcaster data is missing or null in the backend.

test_cases.Title: Display of Last Update Date and Time in List View

Steps.Step Description: Access the application and navigate to the List View of matches.
Steps.Expected Result: The List View of matches is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: For each match displayed, observe the presence of the 'Last Update' information.
Steps.Expected Result: Each match entry displays a 'Last Update' field.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the 'Last Update' field shows date and time in the format GG/MM/AAAA - HH:MM.
Steps.Expected Result: The date and time are displayed in the correct format (e.g., 05/06/2024 - 14:30).

Steps.Step Description: Cross-check the displayed 'Last Update' value with the 'lastUpdate' field from the ProbableLineupFULL API for the same match.
Steps.Expected Result: The displayed value matches exactly with the API value.

test_cases.Preconditions: At least one match is available in the List View. The ProbableLineupFULL API is accessible and returns valid data for matches.
test_cases.Functionality: Display of last update information for matches in List View
test_cases.Dataset: Sample matches with known 'lastUpdate' values in the API.
test_cases.Expected Result: For every match in List View, the last update date and time are displayed in the correct format and match the API value.

test_cases.Title: Display of Last Update Date and Time in Field View

Steps.Step Description: Access the application and navigate to the Field View of a specific match.
Steps.Expected Result: The Field View for the selected match is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the presence of the 'Last Update' information for the match.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Last Update' field is visible in the Field View.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the 'Last Update' field shows date and time in the format GG/MM/AAAA - HH:MM.
Steps.Expected Result: The date and time are displayed in the correct format (e.g., 05/06/2024 - 14:30).

Steps.Step Description: Cross-check the displayed 'Last Update' value with the 'lastUpdate' field from the ProbableLineupFULL API for the same match.
Steps.Expected Result: The displayed value matches exactly with the API value.

test_cases.Preconditions: At least one match is available in the Field View. The ProbableLineupFULL API is accessible and returns valid data for the selected match.
test_cases.Functionality: Display of last update information for matches in Field View
test_cases.Dataset: Sample match with known 'lastUpdate' value in the API.
test_cases.Expected Result: In Field View, the last update date and time are displayed in the correct format and match the API value.

test_cases.Title: Validation of Last Update Format - Incorrect Format Handling

Steps.Step Description: Manipulate the API response to provide a 'lastUpdate' value in an incorrect format (e.g., '2024-06-05T14:30:00Z').
Steps.Expected Result: The application receives the incorrectly formatted date/time.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the List View and Field View for the affected match.
Steps.Expected Result: Both views are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Observe how the application displays the 'Last Update' information.
Steps.Expected Result: The application either correctly formats the date/time to GG/MM/AAAA - HH:MM or displays a clear error/placeholder indicating invalid format.

test_cases.Preconditions: Ability to mock or intercept API responses. At least one match available.
test_cases.Functionality: Error handling for incorrect date/time format in last update field
test_cases.Dataset: Match with manipulated 'lastUpdate' value in API response.
test_cases.Expected Result: The application handles incorrect date/time formats gracefully, either by reformatting or by displaying a clear error/placeholder.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers error handling for format issues.

test_cases.Title: Boundary Test - Last Update at Midnight

Steps.Step Description: Set the 'lastUpdate' value in the API to '05/06/2024 - 00:00' for a match.
Steps.Expected Result: The API returns the specified value.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the List View and Field View for the match.
Steps.Expected Result: Both views are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the 'Last Update' field displays '05/06/2024 - 00:00' in both views.
Steps.Expected Result: The field displays '05/06/2024 - 00:00' exactly as provided.

test_cases.Preconditions: Ability to set or mock API data. At least one match available.
test_cases.Functionality: Boundary value handling for last update field
test_cases.Dataset: Match with 'lastUpdate' set to midnight in API.
test_cases.Expected Result: The application correctly displays midnight values in the required format.

test_cases.Title: No Last Update Data Available - Fallback Handling

Steps.Step Description: Manipulate the API response to omit the 'lastUpdate' field for a match.
Steps.Expected Result: The application receives a match object without 'lastUpdate'.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the List View and Field View for the affected match.
Steps.Expected Result: Both views are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Observe how the application displays the 'Last Update' information for the match.
Steps.Expected Result: The application displays a placeholder (e.g., '-') or a clear message indicating the information is unavailable.

test_cases.Preconditions: Ability to mock or intercept API responses. At least one match available.
test_cases.Functionality: Handling of missing last update data
test_cases.Dataset: Match with missing 'lastUpdate' in API response.
test_cases.Expected Result: The application handles missing 'lastUpdate' gracefully, displaying a placeholder or message.
